intro: Chorizanthe biloba var. biloba, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. The plant produces slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in spikes and are usually pink to red in color, blooming in the spring. The species is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
